channel.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
channel.description: Hey, i live in a neighborhood and there are a lot of people around me with awsome signal strength but i cant connect b/c they are security enabled, any suggestions or tricks?

item.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

No you can’t just connect to any wireless connection with a WEP or WPA password on it unless you know it.

Yes you can crack it easy as pie.

Yes they can figure out when your connect cause you can see who’s connect in your router settings.

Also they can see the websites you go to.

See Who Connected:

Websites:

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?

item.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It isn’t only for linux, but more cards are supported under linux than windows and windows doesn’t support packet injection at all.

Just look on the page of the supported cards to see if your card will work for this.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?

item.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:178685”]If you get the right kind of wireless card, network encryption can be cracked rather easily, especially WEP that can usually be cracked in a matter of minutes.

Check out http://www.aircrack-ng.org/[/quote]
That website is confusing the hell out of me. I cannot understand what they are talking about.
Nothing makes sense :S
See: http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=injection_test
Trying to test if my card works with it simple right? Nope…
Where am i supposed to enter the injection test thing " aireplay-ng -9 wlan0"

edit - i think this is only for linux

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?

item.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

They would be able to tell that it was someone with a certain MAC address (which you can change easily before you crack the security), but will they be able to tell who it is? Most likely not, they would have to walk up on you or maybe if your computer name is the same as your name or something stupid. I don’t know how lawful it is, it probably varies on locality.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?

item.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Yep, pretty sure they’ll be able to tell it was you. It’s also against the law, have fun though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Can you get catched doing this, I mean can someone know that was you when you hack the Wifi?

But very good to use on school network.

item.title: Is it possible to access security enabled wifi w/o pass?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you get the right kind of wireless card, network encryption can be cracked rather easily, especially WEP that can usually be cracked in a matter of minutes.

Check out http://www.aircrack-ng.org/

Read full topic
